Gen Z is lying on resumes? Sure. But here’s the truth nobody wants to admit—everyone is lying on job applications, and companies have been doing it first.

Job postings ask for PhDs, 10 years of experience, and a skill invented last week. Applicants lie to survive the ATS filters, while recruiters pretend they don’t notice. And companies? They’re out here selling “competitive salary” (translation: we compete to pay you the least), “unlimited PTO” (translation: don’t you dare take it), and “permanent positions” (translat
title: WHY EVERYONE IS LYING ON THEIR RESUME!
